Angular - Services

  • References

  1. Observerable

    A publisher is an Observable instance that defines a subscriber function. This function will be executed when a consumer calls the subscribe() method. The subscriber function defines how to obtain or generate values or messages to be published.

    When a consumer (subsriber) call .subscribe(), it must provide an Object that defines how to handle the results returned by the publisher.

    It is not the classcial model of pub-sub. Here, the publish only goes to work when a subscriber called .subscribe(). So it's better to say producer and consumer.

    Whenever a .subscribe is called, we need to provide it ever a callback function, or a group of callback function

                    {
                    next: Required. A handler for each delivered value. Called zero or more times after execution starts
                    error: Optional. A handler for an error notification. An error halts execution of the observable instance.
                    complete: Optional. A handler for the execution-complete notification. Delayed values can continue to be delivered to the next handler after execution is complete.
                }

    Critical section

    Suppose a senario 

                        public_variable: number = 0;
                    query(text: string){
                        this.someServices.query(text).subscribe((data)=>{
                            this.public_variable = data.value;
                        });
                    }

    If the query is continuously execute twice with different text, 1) query('year'), 2) query('age'). Then the public_variable will also going to be set twice. But we are not sure about the order. So eventually, the public_variable can be either 1994 or 24.

    To prevent this happens, we use the last request wins policy

                        public_variable: number = 0;
                    time: number = 0;
                    query(text: string){
                        this.time = Date.now().toString();
                        this.someServices.query(this.time, text).subscribe((data)=>{
                            if(data.time === this.time){
                                this.public_variable = data.value;
                            }
                        });
                    }

  2. Communicate with backend server (it provides the Ajax function)

                    http.get('url', option).subscribe(httpObserver);
                http.post('url', json-content, option).subscribe(httpObserver);
                http.put('url', json-content, option).subscribe(httpObserver);
                http.delete('url', option).subscribe(httpObserver);

                json-content: a json body.
                option:{
                    headers: {
                        user-agent: "chrome",
                        cookies:"",
                        ....
                    }
                }

    A services that uses httpClient

                    import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
                import { HttpClient } from '@angular/common/http';

                @Injectable()
                export class ConfigService {
                    constructor(private http: HttpClient) { }
                    
                }
